info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 11:08AM EDT until April 10 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
.Major flooding will continue on the East Fork White. The crest on the East Fork was near Columbus this morning and should reach Seymour this evening and Rivervale on Tuesday. The Flatrock near Columbus should crest this afternoon, and the Driftwood at Edinburgh should crest tonight. The next chance for more than a tenth of an inch of rain does not return until Wednesday.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
* WHEN...Until Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Highest level since June 2008 for the Driftwood River. Flooding of several residences and seasonal homes along CR 330W and CR 325W very likely. Lowell Rd flooded at CR 250W just east of the bridge. Flooding occurs along several portions of CR 330W and CR 325W including north of Tannehill Rd. Extensive flooding of Tannehill Rd west of bridge and CR 500N east of river. Water within a few feet of CR 250W just west of I-65 rest stop. Water near top of levee on the west side of the river at gage site.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Sunday was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 215 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Bartholomew, IN; Johnson, IN; Shelby, IN
